title: cmd/compile: swapping two elements of a slice generates double the necessary boundary checks
body:
For the following code:
```go
type slice []int
func (s slice) swap(i, j int) {
  s[i], s[j] = s[j], s[i]
}
```

x86 6g 1.4.1 generates:
```asm
	movq	"".s+0(FP),BX
	movq	"".i+24(FP),BP
	movq	"".s+8(FP),R8
	cmpq	BP,R8
	call	,$runtime.panicindex路f+0(SB)
	undef	,
	leaq	BP,BX
	movq	(BX),BP
	movq	BP,"".autotmp_0000+0(SP)
	movq	"".s+0(FP),BX
	movq	"".i+24(FP),BP
	movq	"".s+8(FP),R8
	cmpq	BP,R8
	call	,$runtime.panicindex路f+0(SB)
	undef	,
	leaq	BP,BX
	movq	"".s+0(FP),BP
	movq	"".j+32(FP),R8
	movq	"".s+8(FP),R9
	cmpq	R8,R9
	call	,$runtime.panicindex路f+0(SB)
	undef	,
	leaq	R8,BP
	movq	(BP),R8
	movq	R8,(BX)
	movq	"".s+0(FP),BX
	movq	"".j+32(FP),BP
	movq	"".s+8(FP),R8
	cmpq	BP,R8
	call	,$runtime.panicindex路f+0(SB)
	undef	,
	leaq	BP,BX
	movq	"".autotmp_0000+0(SP),BP
	movq	BP,(BX)
```

This is double than the necessary boundary checks. Moreover, in the best case there should be only a boundary check for max(i, j).
